Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant's marriage is genuine and not primarily for immigration purposes
Evidence_Type: Documentation on marriage arrangement, timing, financial aspects
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - genuineness of marriage requirement
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage was allegedly arranged primarily for immigration benefits
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Appeal before immigration panel followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Discrepancies in application details provided by applicant
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Genuine marriage not entered into primarily for immigration purposes
Crimes.Application_Factor: Timing and circumstances of marriage, financial interdependence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Appeal dismissed; marriage not recognized as genuine
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the panel’s credibility assessment was reasonable
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section of IRPA on spousal sponsorship and marriage genuineness
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Contradictions in testimonies and lack of credible evidence supporting marriage genuineness
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section related to spousal sponsorship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in dates, financial details, and marital cohabitation
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed procedural norms; no breach identified
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Suspected but not proven; inconsistencies raised suspicion
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Significant credibility concerns due to conflicting statements
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant challenged reasonableness of panel’s decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review focused on adequacy of reasoning and evidence assessment
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide consistent and corroborative evidence

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration appeal regarding authenticity of arranged marriage
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the marriage is genuine and not entered into primarily for immigration benefits
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refusal based on marriage credibility
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Doubts due to inconsistencies in testimonies and financial details
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA provisions on spousal sponsorship and marriage genuineness
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Marriage arranged with suspicious timing and lack of shared life indicators
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Contradictions in meeting dates, financial interdependence, and cohabitation
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Sponsorship application appeal and judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Visa officer and Immigration Appeal Division
Crimes.Application_Error: Inconsistent information provided in application and interviews
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Marriage must be genuine, not primarily for immigration advantage
Crimes.Application_Factor: Nature of arranged marriage, cultural context, proof of shared life
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Sponsorship refused; marriage deemed not genuine
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the panel reasonably assessed credibility and evidence
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA section on spousal relationships and misrepresentation
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Judicial review dismissed; no legal error found
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient proof of genuine marital relationship; inconsistencies in evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, relevant sections on spousal sponsorship
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancies in timelines, lack of joint financial activity, weak corroboration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Fair process conducted; opportunity to respond provided
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Serious credibility concerns based on conflicting accounts
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Focus on sufficiency of evidence and credibility evaluation
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to substantiate claims with credible evidence
